item.title: Dangerous traffic light fault, 28th February
item.description:
The traffic light pedestrian crossing outside the Royal Albert Hall on Kensington Gore - the lights from one direction turn red whilst the lights from the opposite direction are still green. I have seen pedestrians begin to cross as they believe the lights are red but one direction is still green

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kensington Gore, Knightsbridge, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Pothole in Bus Lane, 28th February
item.description:
There is a large pot hole in the left side of the bus lane on West Parkside heading towards North Greenwich and the O2 arena. Pothole is very deep and lower road surface is visible
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Edmund Halley Way, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footballers dirt on pavements, 28th February
item.description:
I went out for a walk in Beckenham this afternoon. You can see on the pavements near Harvington & the pavements outside Stanhope Rec Ground. Stanhope Grove, where footballers bang their football boots & leave the dirt on the pavements outside people's houses. I know this is beyond your control, but is there any way notices can be put up, where you see fit, asking that football boots be cleaned at home & not on our pavements. Many thanks. Kindest regards Carol Barnard
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merlin Grove, Eden Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog Notices, 28th February
item.description:
Good evening Many thanks for providing new dog fouling notices in our street, Merlin Grove I would be most grateful if you can please put more notices in our street & at the end of our street leading I to Eden Park Avenue. Thank you, Bromley Council, you are always so helpful. Hope you have had a lovely weekend. Kindest regards Carol Barnard
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merlin Grove, Eden Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing double yellow lines parking restrictions, 28th February
item.description:
There needs to be a double yellow line on the left right up to and beyond where the cars are parked. The absence of this causes buses to struggle to get past and in many occasions they have been blocked completely.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wolves Lane, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The resident at 6 broadlands avenue, enfield, EN3 areaalways leave their bin on the road, 28th February
item.description:
The resident of 6, broadlands avenue, Enfield always places his blue bin on the road so that he can use his driveway. Please note that his curb is not dropped and therefore he is driving on the pavement to enter his driveway. There is also a parking just infront of that house which is always blocked no matter what days of the week it is therefore blocking other users from parking their car

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Broadlands Avenue, Enfield
Report on FixMyStreet
